preamble.title: Our Commitment to Your Privacy
preamble.p1: This Privacy Policy describes how Nomadik GmbH, Bergstrasse 10, 8712 Stäfa, Switzerland ('Nomadik', 'Platform', 'we', 'us'), as the 'Data Controller', collects, uses, shares, and protects your personal data when you use our Platform.
preamble.p2: This policy is an integral part of our <1>Terms of Service (TOS)</1>. By using our Services, you agree to the data processing practices described in this policy.

chapter1.title: 1. What Information We Collect
chapter1.intro: To provide and improve our services, we collect various types of information. We strive to collect only the data that is strictly necessary for the respective purpose.

direct.title: 1.1. Information You Provide to Us Directly
direct.p1: This is data that you actively enter when you interact with our platform.

list.account: <0>Account Registration:</0> Name, email address, password (securely hashed), role (Client/Coach), and preferred language.
list.profile: <0>Profile Information:</0> Any data you voluntarily add, such as bio, job title, location, interests, profile picture, introduction video, as well as (for Coaches) areas of expertise, qualifications, education, and professional experience.
list.financial: <0>Financial & Billing Information:</0> Billing address, company name, Value Added Tax (VAT) identification number, and other tax-relevant information. We <1>never</1> store your full credit card details. These are securely processed by our payment processor, Stripe, from whom we receive a reference (token).
list.communications: <0>Communications:</0> Content of messages you send via our messaging system, support tickets you create, and reviews you write, including private feedback.
list.verification: <0>Verification Data (for Coaches):</0> Information and documents you submit to verify qualifications or for insurance recognition.

automatic.title: 1.2. Information We Collect Automatically
automatic.p1: When you use our Platform, our servers automatically collect certain technical information.

list.usage: <0>Usage Data:</0> Information about how you interact with the Platform, e.g., pages visited, features used, search queries, clicks, and time spent on pages.
list.log: <0>Log & Device Data:</0> IP address, browser type, operating system, device IDs, access times, and crash data. We collect your IP address at the time of agreement to our TOS as legal proof.
list.cookies: <0>Cookies & Similar Technologies:</0> We use cookies to ensure the functionality of the Platform, save settings, and analyze usage. Details can be found in our (future) Cookie Policy.
list.transaction: <0>Transaction Metadata:</0> For financial transactions, we collect metadata such as IP address and user-agent for fraud prevention and regulatory compliance.

activity.title: 1.3. Information Arising from Your Activities on the Platform
activity.p1: This is data generated by your specific use of our coaching services.

list.booking: <0>Booking & Appointment Data:</0> Start and end times, time zone, status, booked session type, duration, and participating users of a session.
list.session: <0>Interaction Metadata:</0> We collect metadata about interactions within a session, such as the use of the 'raise hand' feature or sending feedback, but not the content of your conversations.
list.live: <0>Live Session Data:</0> For live sessions billed by the minute, we collect the exact start and end time, the billed duration, and technical 'heartbeats' to monitor the connection and ensure correct billing.
list.progress: <0>Learning Progress Data:</0> When you participate in programs, we store your progress, including completed lessons, quiz results, and submitted assignments (texts and files).
list.recordings: <0>Session Recordings:</0> We <1>never</1> store the content (audio/video) of your sessions unless a participant <2>actively</2> initiates a recording and <3>all</3> participants give their <4>explicit consent</4>. In this case, we store the video file, its metadata (duration, size), and proof of the consent given.

chapter2.title: 2. How We Use Your Information
chapter2.intro: Your data is processed exclusively on the basis of legal provisions and for the legitimate purposes set out below.

provide.title: 2.1. To Provide and Operate the Platform
provide.p1: The majority of our data processing serves to fulfill our contract with you, namely to provide our coaching platform.

list.accounts: <0>Account Management:</0> We use your registration and profile data to create, secure, and manage your account.
list.facilitate: <0>Facilitating & Conducting Coaching:</0> We use your profile, booking, and availability data to enable connections between clients and coaches, and to schedule and conduct sessions.
list.payments: <0>Payment Processing:</0> Your financial and booking data is used to process payments to coaches and to invoice clients. This includes calculating prices, discounts, and creating statements.
list.access: <0>Access to Purchased Content:</0> We use your login and learning progress data to ensure you have permanent access to programs you have purchased.
list.support: <0>Customer Support:</0> When you contact us, we use your account information and communication history to process your request and resolve technical issues. This may require administrative access to your account as part of support, as defined in the TOS.

improve.title: 2.2. To Improve and Secure Our Services
improve.p1: We have a legitimate interest in continuously improving our platform and protecting it from misuse.

list.analytics: <0>Analysis & Product Development:</0> We analyze aggregated and anonymized usage data to identify trends, improve user experience, and develop new features.
list.security: <0>Security & Fraud Prevention:</0> We use log and device data, as well as transaction metadata, to detect suspicious activities, review our security measures, and prevent fraud.
list.integrity: <0>Community Integrity:</0> We may review reviews, reports, and communication content to investigate violations of our Community Guidelines and maintain safety and professionalism on the platform.

communicate.title: 2.3. To Communicate With You
communicate.p1: We use your contact details to get in touch with you.

list.transactional: <0>Transactional Notifications:</0> We send you necessary emails and in-app notifications regarding your activities, such as booking confirmations, appointment reminders, or payment receipts.
list.administrative: <0>Administrative Communications:</0> We inform you about important changes to our services, our TOS, or this Privacy Policy.
list.marketing: <0>Marketing & Newsletters:</0> We will only send you marketing emails if you have explicitly consented. You can withdraw your consent at any time via the unsubscribe link in every email or in your account settings.

legal.title: 2.4. To Fulfill Legal and Regulatory Obligations
legal.p1: In certain cases, we are legally required to process your data.

list.invoicing: <0>Invoicing & Tax Law:</0> We use your billing and transaction data to create legally compliant invoices and tax documents and to fulfill our accounting obligations.
list.enforce: <0>Enforcement of Our Agreements:</0> We may use your data to enforce our TOS and Community Guidelines, including investigating and resolving disputes between users.
list.requests: <0>Governmental Requests:</0> We may disclose data to law enforcement agencies or courts if we are legally required to do so, or to protect the rights and safety of the Platform or third parties.

chapter3.title: 3. How We Share Your Information
chapter3.intro: We do not sell your personal data under any circumstances. Your data is only shared with third parties for the purposes described in this policy and on a valid legal basis.

users.title: 3.1. Between Users on the Platform
users.p1: The core function of our platform is to connect people. Therefore, certain information is necessarily shared with other users:

list.profile: <0>Public Profiles:</0> Information you provide in your public profile (e.g., name, profile picture, bio, areas of expertise) is visible to other users to enable an informed choice.
list.booking: <0>During the Booking Process:</0> When a client requests or books a session with a coach, we share the necessary information to conduct the session (e.g., names of participants) between the involved parties.
list.communication: <0>In Communication:</0> When you send messages via the platform, they are visible to the recipient.

providers.title: 3.2. With Our Service Providers (Data Processors)
providers.p1: We work with carefully selected third-party providers who process data on our behalf to enable our services. We have Data Processing Agreements (DPAs) with these providers, ensuring they process your data only according to our instructions and in compliance with strict security standards.

list.payments: <0>Payment Processing:</0> We share your billing and transaction data with <1>Stripe, Inc.</1> to securely process payments, manage payouts, prevent fraud, and create invoices.
list.hosting: <0>Cloud Hosting & Storage:</0> Our platform and your data, including uploaded files and optional session recordings, are hosted on the infrastructure of leading cloud providers like <1>Amazon Web Services (AWS)</1> or <3>Google Cloud Platform (GCP)</3>.
list.files: <0>File & Media Storage:</0> For storing, processing, and delivering profile pictures, videos, and program materials, we use the services of <1>Cloudinary, Ltd</1>.
list.communication: <0>Communication Services:</0> We use specialized providers like <1>Postmark</1> (for transactional emails) or <3>Twilio</3> (for SMS notifications) to communicate with you.
list.analytics: <0>Analytics Tools:</0> We may share aggregated and anonymized usage data with analytics services like <1>Google Analytics</1> or <3>Plausible Analytics</3> to understand the usage of our platform.
list.queues: <0>Background Processing:</0> We use services like <1>Redis</1> to manage background tasks (e.g., notifications, billing cycles) that require processing of task-related data.

legal.title: 3.3. For Legal Reasons and Protection
legal.p1: We may share information about you if we believe in good faith that it is reasonably necessary to:

list.compliance: comply with a legal obligation, a court order, or an enforceable governmental request.
list.enforce: enforce our Terms of Service and other agreements, including the investigation of potential violations.
list.security: detect, prevent, or otherwise address security threats, fraud, or technical issues.
list.protect: protect the rights, property, or safety of Nomadik GmbH, our users, or the public from imminent harm.

transfer.title: 3.4. In Case of a Business Transfer
transfer.p1: In the event of a merger, acquisition, reorganization, bankruptcy, or sale of all or a portion of our assets, your data may be transferred to a successor entity as part of that transaction. We will notify you of such an event and give you the opportunity to object to the transfer of your data.

chapter4.title: 4. Your Data Protection Rights & Choices
chapter4.intro: We recognize and respect your rights regarding your personal data. Depending on the applicable laws, you have the following rights:

access.title: 4.1. Right to Access
access.p1: You have the right to request confirmation as to whether we process personal data about you and to receive a copy of that data.

rectification.title: 4.2. Right to Rectification
rectification.p1: If the data stored about you is inaccurate or incomplete, you have the right to request its correction. You can edit most of your profile data directly in your account settings.

erasure.title: 4.3. Right to Erasure ('Right to be Forgotten')
erasure.p1: You have the right to request the deletion of your personal data. You can initiate this process through your account settings. Please note that we cannot comply with this request in all cases.
erasure.p2: <0>Important Limitation:</0> We are legally obligated to retain certain data for a prescribed period even after your account is deleted. This particularly applies to transaction data, invoices, and tax-relevant documents (usually for 10 years according to the Swiss Code of Obligations). After account deletion, this data will be blocked and used only to fulfill these legal obligations.

portability.title: 4.4. Right to Data Portability
portability.p1: You have the right to receive the personal data you have provided to us in a structured, commonly used, and machine-readable format and to transmit this data to another controller.

objection.title: 4.5. Right to Object
objection.p1: You have the right to object to the processing of your personal data based on our legitimate interests. In particular, you can object to the use of your data for marketing purposes at any time by using the unsubscribe link in our emails or adjusting your notification settings.

restriction.title: 4.6. Right to Restriction of Processing
restriction.p1: Under certain conditions, you can request the restriction of the processing of your data, for example, while we are verifying the accuracy of your data.

exercise.title: 4.7. Exercising Your Rights
exercise.p1: To exercise any of your rights, please contact us at the email address provided in Chapter 7. To prevent misuse, we may require proof of identity before processing your request.

complaint.title: 4.8. Right to Lodge a Complaint
complaint.p1: If you believe that the processing of your personal data violates data protection law, you have the right to lodge a complaint with the competent supervisory authority. In Switzerland, this is the Federal Data Protection and Information Commissioner (FDPIC).

chapter5.title: 5. Data Security & International Transfers
chapter5.intro: The protection of your data is our highest priority. We take comprehensive technical and organizational measures to protect your data from unauthorized access, loss, destruction, or alteration.

security.title: 5.1. Our Security Measures
security.p1: Although no online transmission or electronic storage is 100% secure, we use industry-standard practices to ensure the security of your data. Our measures include, but are not limited to:

list.encryption: <0>Encryption:</0> We encrypt sensitive data both in transit (using TLS/SSL) and at rest. Particularly sensitive communication content is additionally encrypted at the application level.
list.access: <0>Access Controls:</0> Access to personal data is restricted to employees and contractors who absolutely need this information to perform their duties and are subject to strict confidentiality obligations.
list.audits: <0>Regular Reviews:</0> We regularly review our data collection, storage, and processing practices, as well as our physical security measures, to protect against unauthorized access to our systems.
list.payments: <0>Secure Payment Processing:</0> All payment processing is handled by our PCI-DSS certified partner, Stripe. We do not store full credit card numbers on our servers.

transfers.title: 5.2. International Data Transfers
transfers.p1: Our platform operates on a global infrastructure. This means that your personal data may be transferred to and processed in countries outside of Switzerland and the European Union (EU) / European Economic Area (EEA), where our service providers (see Chapter 3.2) are located.
transfers.p2: Such transfers only occur if an adequate level of data protection is guaranteed. We rely on:

list.adequacy: <0>Adequacy Decisions:</0> Transfers to countries for which the European Commission or the Swiss Federal Council has recognized an adequate level of data protection.
list.scc: <0>Standard Contractual Clauses (SCCs):</0> For transfers to other countries (such as the USA), we conclude the Standard Contractual Clauses approved by the European Commission and adapted for Switzerland with our service providers. These clauses contractually oblige the data recipient to comply with European and Swiss data protection standards.

transfers.p3: By using our services, you consent to these necessary international data transfers.

chapter6.title: 6. Data Storage and Retention Periods
chapter6.intro: We store your personal data only as long as necessary to fulfill the purposes for which it was collected, to meet our contractual and legal obligations, or as long as we have a legitimate interest in storing it.

account.title: 6.1. Data During Account Lifetime
account.p1: As long as you maintain an active account with us, we retain the data necessary for providing the services and managing your account (e.g., your profile information, booking history, learning progress).

retention.title: 6.2. Data After Account Deletion
retention.p1: After you request the deletion of your account, we will handle your data as follows:

list.immediate: <0>Immediate Anonymization/Deletion:</0> Data that is not subject to retention requirements, such as your profile picture, bio, IP logs, and most usage data, will be promptly deleted or irreversibly anonymized.
list.legal: <0>Legal Retention Periods:</0> Data relevant to our business and tax records (especially invoices, transaction receipts, and related communication logs) must be retained for a period of <1>ten (10) years</1> according to the Swiss Code of Obligations. After account deletion, this data is blocked for normal operation and is only accessible for audit and compliance purposes.
list.content: <0>Purchased Content:</0> According to our TOS, clients who have purchased your programs retain access to this content even after your coach account is deleted. The content itself will therefore remain stored on the platform.

backups.title: 6.3. Data in Backups
backups.p1: Deleted data may remain in our backup archives for a limited period until they are overwritten. These backups are locked for operational use and are not used to restore individual data.

updates.title: 7.1. Changes to This Privacy Policy
updates.p1: We reserve the right to change this Privacy Policy at any time to adapt it to new legal requirements or changes in our services. The most current version will be published on our platform. In case of material changes, we will inform you in a timely manner via the email address you have provided or through a prominent notice on the platform.

contact.title: 7.2. Contact Information
contact.p1: If you have questions about data protection, wish to exercise your rights, or have concerns about your data, please contact our Data Protection Officer:
